Field.Label: Internal Application Information (Freedom House use only)
Instructions to the Martus User:
Field.Message:
The Defenders Fund provides assistance, including emergency funds and services, to human rights defenders and human rights organizations that are under threat, attack, detention, prosecution, or otherwise at immediate risk due to government repression. The Defenders Fund will only provide assistance to individuals and groups who do not espouse violence, advocate for or engage in human rights violations.
Grant requests may be made directly to the Defenders Fund or referred through individuals and organizations.

Choices.Choice: DRL Denied-FH Approved w/ Private Funding

Field.Label: Instructions
Field.Message: Please provide the following information if you are submitting an application on behalf of a defender or an organization:

Field.Label: Defender Bio Data Instructions
Field.Message: Requests made on behalf of an INDIVIDUAL must include the following:

Field.Label: Defender Bio Data (Freedom House use only)
Defender Bio Data Instructions
Field.Message: Requests made on behalf of an ORGANIZATION must include the following:

Field.Label: Full Names of All Organization Directors:
Case Summary Section Instructions:
Field.Message: Please answer the following questions to the best of your ability in the space provided below.

Field.Label: Previous Work:
Field.Message: What kind of work has the defender done to advance human rights?

Field.Label: Threat to the Defender:
Field.Message: EMERGENCY - Please describe the threat to the defender, where it comes from and why the need for funding is urgent. For the purposes of this Fund, the emergency should be caused by government repression. In most cases, the cause will be clear. However there may be circumstances leading to a determination that a government is the source. If that is the case, please explain those circumstances.

Field.Label: Funding Need:
Field.Message: How will funding help the defender continue his/her work in human rights?

Field.Label: See Supporting Documents:
Field.Message: If you have supporting documentation that you would like to attach for consideration alongside your application, please see "Supporting Documentation" Section below.

Field.Label: Instructions:
Field.Message: Please fill out the type of requested assistance, the amount and how the funds will be used. Funds can be used for legal, medical, humanitarian (including dependent support) or other needs including prison monitoring and support, trial monitoring, investigations, and replacement of confiscated or damaged/destroyed equipment.

Field.Label: Instructions for Breakdown of Assistance:
Field.Message: The "Notes" field in the following grid is intended for summary notes. If you would like to include further detail on the breakdown of the assistance, please use the field "Further Notes on Breakdown of Assistance and Amounts".

Field.Label: Breakdown of Requested Assistance and Amounts:
Further notes on breakdown of assistance and amounts:
Please identify potential obstacles in transferring the funds such as local laws and practices, and ways to limit further harm to the defender and/or those helping in the transfer:
If awarded, what is the best method to disburse funds?:

Choices.Choice: Western Union/ Money Gram to an Intermediary

Field.Value:
The Defenders Fund provides assistance, including emergency funds and services, to human rights defenders and human rights organizations that are under threat, attack, detention, prosecution, or otherwise at immediate risk due to government repression. The Defenders Fund will only provide assistance to individuals and groups who do not espouse violence, advocate for or engage in human rights violations.
Grant requests may be made directly to the Defenders Fund or referred through individuals and organizations.
Please provide the following information if you are submitting an application on behalf of a defender or an organization:
Requests made on behalf of an INDIVIDUAL must include the following:
Requests made on behalf of an ORGANIZATION must include the following:
Please answer the following questions to the best of your ability in the space provided below.
What kind of work has the defender done to advance human rights?

EMERGENCY - Please describe the threat to the defender, where it comes from and why the need for funding is urgent. For the purposes of this Fund, the emergency should be caused by government repression. In most cases, the cause will be clear. However there may be circumstances leading to a determination that a government is the source. If that is the case, please explain those circumstances.
How will funding help the defender continue his/her work in human rights?
If you have supporting documentation that you would like to attach for consideration alongside your application, please see "Supporting Documentation" Section below.

Please fill out the type of requested assistance, the amount and how the funds will be used. Funds can be used for legal, medical, humanitarian (including dependent support) or other needs including prison monitoring and support, trial monitoring, investigations, and replacement of confiscated or damaged/destroyed equipment.

The "Notes" field in the following grid is intended for summary notes. If you would like to include further detail on the breakdown of the assistance, please use the field "Further Notes on Breakdown of Assistance and Amounts".
If available, please provide information aiding transfer of funds - including: banking information for potential wires; full names, date of births and addresses of intermediaries.
Has the defender received funds from another organization in response to this emergency?
Please include two references other than referring individual/ organization. We ask that at least one reference be international.
If checked yes under "Contacted?" above, please see below "Vetting and Communication."

Please list all people contacted regarding this application - including, FH staff, regional partners, referral network, references and others. (The "Notes" field in the following grid is intended for summary notes. If you would like to include further detail on whether references have been contacted, please use the field "Further Notes on Whether References Have Been Contacted" below.)
Please select the country in which emergency originated.

The "Notes" field in the following grid is intended for summary notes. If you would like to include further detail on the relevant findings, please use the field "Further Notes on Relevant Findings" below.

The "Notes" field in the following grid is intended for summary notes. If you would like to include further detail on the breakdown of the assistance, please use the field "Further Notes on Concerns" below.

The "Notes" field in the following grid is intended for summary notes. If you would like to include further detail on the breakdown of total request by cost type, please use the field "Further Notes on Breakdown of Total Original Award by Cost Type" below.
If LOA with Intermediary, please see "Intermediary" Section below.
If it is expected that funds will be disbursed through a known intermediary, please include their information below.
Please provide the following data on the intermediary:
If intermediary is an organization, please list all board members and executive staff.
If intermediary is an individual, please provide Date of Birth and Passport Number below.

Please indicate the amount of each tranche of funds disbursed by Freedom House, the direct recipient of funds, the date funds were received by the intermediary (if applicable) and the date the funds were received by the end beneficiary.
The "Notes" field in the following grid is intended for summary notes. If you would like to include further detail on the impact, please use the field "Further Notes on Impact" below.
Please provide any additional information that you feel was not covered elsewhere in this form but is relevant to your application.

When available, please provide supporting documentation of the defender's case and request for assistance. Forms of documentation may include, but are not limited to: newspaper articles, pictures, court documents, medical bills, legal bills, testimony, etc.

Field.Value: Test complete old internal version import into complete new

The Defenders Fund provides assistance, including emergency funds and services, to human rights defenders and human rights organizations that are under threat, attack, detention, prosecution, or otherwise at immediate risk due to government repression. The Defenders Fund will only provide assistance to individuals and groups who do not espouse violence, advocate for or engage in human rights violations.
Grant requests may be made directly to the Defenders Fund or referred through individuals and organizations.
Please provide the following information if you are submitting an application on behalf of a defender or an organization:
Requests made on behalf of an INDIVIDUAL must include the following:
Requests made on behalf of an ORGANIZATION must include the following:
Please answer the following questions to the best of your ability in the space provided below.
What kind of work has the defender done to advance human rights?

EMERGENCY – Please describe the threat to the defender, where it comes from and why the need for funding is urgent. For the purposes of this Fund, the emergency should be caused by government repression. In most cases, the cause will be clear. However there may be circumstances leading to a determination that a government is the source. If that is the case, please explain those circumstances.
How will funding help the defender continue his/her work in human rights?
If you have supporting documentation that you would like to attach for consideration alongside your application, please see “Supporting Documentation” Section below.

Please fill out the type of requested assistance, the amount and how the funds will be used. Funds can be used for legal, medical, humanitarian (including dependent support) or other needs including prison monitoring and support, trial monitoring, investigations, and replacement of confiscated or damaged/destroyed equipment.

The “Notes” field in the following grid is intended for summary notes. If you would like to include further detail on the breakdown of the assistance, please use the field “Further Notes on Breakdown of Assistance and Amounts”.
If available, please provide information aiding transfer of funds – including: banking information for potential wires; full names, date of births and addresses of intermediaries.
Has the defender received funds from another organization in response to this emergency?
If checked yes under “Contacted?” above, please see below “Vetting and Communication.”

Please list all people contacted regarding this application – including, FH staff, regional partners, referral network, references and others. (The “Notes” field in the following grid is intended for summary notes. If you would like to include further detail on whether references have been contacted, please use the field “Further Notes on Whether References Have Been Contacted” below.)
Please select the country in which emergency originated.

The “Notes” field in the following grid is intended for summary notes. If you would like to include further detail on the relevant findings, please use the field “Further Notes on Relevant Findings” below.

The “Notes” field in the following grid is intended for summary notes. If you would like to include further detail on the breakdown of the assistance, please use the field “Further Notes on Concerns” below.

The “Notes” field in the following grid is intended for summary notes. If you would like to include further detail on the breakdown of total request by cost type, please use the field “Further Notes on Breakdown of Total Request by Cost Type” below.
If LOA with Intermediary, please see “Intermediary” Section below.
Please provide the following data on the intermediary:
If intermediary is an organization, please list all board members and executive staff.
If intermediary is an individual, please provide Date of Birth and Passport Number below.
The “Notes” field in the following grid is intended for summary notes. If you would like to include further detail on the impact, please use the field “Further Notes on Impact” below.
Please provide any additional information that you feel was not covered elsewhere in this form but is relevant to your application.

When available, please provide supporting documentation of the defender’s case and request for assistance. Forms of documentation may include, but are not limited to: newspaper articles, pictures, court documents, medical bills, legal bills, testimony, etc.

Grant requests may be made directly to the Defenders Fund or referred through individuals and organizations.

Field.Label: Instructions
Field.Message: Please provide the following information if you are submitting an application on behalf of a defender or an organization:

Field.Label: Defender Bio Data Instructions
Field.Message: Requests made on behalf of an INDIVIDUAL must include the following:

Field.Label: Defender Bio Data Instructions
Field.Message: Requests made on behalf of an ORGANIZATION must include the following:

Field.Label: Full Names of All Organization Directors:
Case Summary Section Instructions:
Field.Message: Please answer the following questions to the best of your ability in the space provided below.

Field.Label: Previous Work:
Field.Message: What kind of work has the defender done to advance human rights?

Field.Label: Threat to the Defender:
Field.Message: EMERGENCY – Please describe the threat to the defender, where it comes from and why the need for funding is urgent. For the purposes of this Fund, the emergency should be caused by government repression. In most cases, the cause will be clear. However there may be circumstances leading to a determination that a government is the source. If that is the case, please explain those circumstances.

Field.Label: Funding Need:
Field.Message: How will funding help the defender continue his/her work in human rights?

Field.Label: See Supporting Documents:
Field.Message: If you have supporting documentation that you would like to attach for consideration alongside your application, please see “Supporting Documentation” Section below.

Field.Label: Instructions:
Field.Message: Please fill out the type of requested assistance, the amount and how the funds will be used. Funds can be used for legal, medical, humanitarian (including dependent support) or other needs including prison monitoring and support, trial monitoring, investigations, and replacement of confiscated or damaged/destroyed equipment.

Field.Label: Title Note
Field.Message: Choose a short, descriptive title that distinguish this bulletin from other bulletins

Field.Label: Summary Note
Field.Message: This should be ONE paragraph that tells the basic story of the event: Who did what to whom, when and where

Field.Label: Section 2. Where the event took place
Location City Geolist State/Division Note
Field.Message: Indicate where the event took place State/Division being the broadest and Location the narrowest place. Enter the code for district and township found in the Geolist

Field.Label: Categories of HRVs Note
Field.Message: Check the HRV categories from the Top 16 list which apply.

Field.Label: Keywords Note
Field.Message: This field is for more descriptions of the context of the violations. For example, if it was part of a bigger event (e.g. "8888" or "four-cuts," was carried out in the context of a situation your organization is keeping track of, e.g. "drugs" or "women's rights").

Field.Label: Eventdate
Field.Message: Please note that you can choose a specific date, or a range if (1) the violation occurred over the course of many days, or (2) if you know the general time period but not an exact date.

Field.Label: Biographical Data Note
Field.Message: Please fill out separate rows in the table below for each person or group of persons. If you are unsure of a person's Age, enter a range (e.g. 20-30) or description (e.g. child). Values for Civil Status should be: single, married, widowed, divorced, live-in partner, etc. Examples of Profession/activity include: farmer, student, professor, trade union, political, religious, humanitarian/solidarity/human rights, military, police, persons in uniform or civilian clothes, agents of security services, prison staff, members of armed groups or criminal gangs etc. For perpetrators please specify rank and functions, etc. Other address/present whereabouts could be name of prison, refugee camp, etc. Institutional affiliation could be NLD, LIB 384, USDA, etc. Choose the person or group of persons role in the event from the drop down list in the Role in Event field. For the Individual Biographical Data grid, please disregard Corporate Name and ID. These two fields should be filled out only for the Group Biographical Data grid.

Field.Label: Source of Information Note
Field.Message: Enter who provided the information. In most cases, this will be the person your field worker spoke with, e.g. "witness." In other cases, it may be a newspaper or possibly another organization.

Field.Label: Accuracy Note
Field.Message: Rank how accurate you believe the information to be in the A column. Choose 5 for not accurate, 1 for 100% accurate.

Field.Label: Section 7. Detail narrative of the event

Field.Value: Choose a short, descriptive title that distinguish this bulletin from other bulletins
Test ND-Burma bulletin - for Search Demo
This should be ONE paragraph that tells the basic story of the event: Who did what to whom, when and where
Indicate where the event took place State/Division being the broadest and Location the narrowest place. Enter the code for district and township found in the Geolist
Check the HRV categories from the Top 16 list which apply.

Field.Label: Internal Author Information (Freedom House use only)
Instructions to the Martus User:
Field.Message:
The Defenders Fund provides assistance, including emergency funds and services, to human rights defenders and human rights organizations that are under threat, attack, detention, prosecution, or otherwise at immediate risk due to government repression. The Fund will only provide assistance to individuals and groups who do not espouse violence, advocate for or engage in human rights violations.
Grant requests may be made directly to the Defenders Fund or referred through individuals and organizations.

Field.Label: Instructions
Field.Message: Please provide the following information if you are submitting an application on behalf of a Defender or an organization:

Field.Label: Defender Bio Data Instructions
Field.Message: Requests made on behalf of an INDIVIDUAL must include the following:

Field.Label: Defender Bio Data (Freedom House use only)
Defender Bio Data Instructions
Field.Message: Requests made on behalf of an ORGANIZATION must include the following:

Field.Label: Full Names of All Organization Directors:
Case Summary Section Instructions:
Field.Message: Please answer the following questions to the best of your ability in the space provided below.

Field.Label: What kind of work has the defender done to advance human rights?

EMERGENCY – Please describe the threat to the defender, where it comes from and why the need for funding is urgent. For the purposes of this Fund, the emergency should be caused by government repression. In most cases, the cause will be clear. However there may be circumstances leading to a determination that a government is the source. If that is the case, please explain those circumstances.
How will funding help the defender continue his/her work in human rights?
Instructions:
Field.Message: Please fill out the type of requested assistance, the amount and how the funds will be used. Funds can be used for legal, medical, humanitarian (including dependent support) or other needs including prison monitoring and support, trial monitoring, investigations, and replacement of confiscated or damaged/destroyed equipment.

Field.Label: Breakdown of Requested Assistance and Amounts:
If awarded, what is the best method to disburse funds?

Choices.Choice: Western Union/ Money Gram to an Intermediary

Field.Label: Please identify potential obstacles in transferring the funds such as local laws, practices and ways to limit further harm to the defenders and/or those helping in the transfer.
If available, please provide information aiding transfer of funds –including: banking information for potential wires; full names, date of births and addresses of intermediaries.
Has the defender received funds from another organization in response to this emergency?

Column.Label: Contacted? (Freedom House use only) If yes, please see below "Vetting and Communication"

Field.Message: When available, please provide supporting documentation of the defender’s case and request for assistance. Forms of documentation may include, but are not limited to: newspaper articles, pictures, court documents, medical bills, legal bills, testimony, etc.

Freedom of the press, theft, harassment
On June 1st 1996 armed assailants attacked the offices of a prominent local newspaper. They destroyed property, intimidated staff, and issued threats.
